Text saved: Today, much business, which means buying and selling goods or services, happens between different countries. Even though most people involved in world business speak English, communication, which is how we send and receive messages, can change a lot because of culture. Culture means the shared ideas, customs, and ways of behaving of a group of people. If we do not understand the customs and habits of the people we work with, it can cause unfair opinions, misunderstandings, and problems in communication. Etiquette, which is a set of rules for polite behaviour, is different in many places. Here are three basic ways in which business etiquette changes around the world, and knowing these can help you when you work with someone from another culture.
